description: The process of serialization is called "pickling," and deserialization is called "unpickling." A PKL file is pickled to save space when being stored or transferred over a network then is unpickled and loaded back into program memory during runtime. The PKL file is created using Python pickle and the dump() method and is loaded using Python pickle and the load() method.

There are three protocols used for pickling: Version 0 - The original ASCII protocol, which is backwards compatible with earlier Python versions. Version 1 - The old binary format, which is backwards compatible with earlier Python versions. Version 2 - Python 2.3 format, which features more efficient pickling of new style classes. NOTE: PKL files may also have the .PICKLE extension but more commonly have the .P extension.
NOTE: PKL files may also have the .PICKLE extension but more commonly have the .P extension.
